intro: Tetraplasandra lydgatei var. coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved tetraplasandra, is a rare and unique plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery, and textured leaves. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Its foliage is dense and aromatic, with a distinctive appearance that sets it apart from other species in the genus. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a valuable and endangered species in its native range.
